page.title: 01LANDSCAPE IN 04760354
page.content: The landscape in 04760354 has been formed by the ravages of the Ice Age. Thus the Trent River Valley evolved. The Trent meanders from slightly higher ground near Averham Church skirting the built up village area, through lower cultivated farmland it circumnavigates Kelham Hall.Here land is likely to frequent flooding in the populated area of Kelham beyond the river.The river winds onwards and arrives below the higher ground on which Newark Castle is situated.The lower land below this is again a built up area which is subject to flooding. The main A617 road winds past Averham through Kelham and is one of the routes through Newark.This is a very busy road and is subject to much congestion.A by-pass is proposed in the future.A railway line also crosses the area.
